body:
@karuppiah7890 

Output of helm version:
```
~ â¯â¯â¯ helm version                                                                                                                                                                                                             
Client: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.14.3", GitCommit:"0e7f3b6637f7af8fcfddb3d2941fcc7cbebb0085", GitTreeState:"clean"}
```

Similar message reports on v2.14.3
```
~ â¯â¯â¯ helm package blah-bloo-blee-blee
Error: chart metadata (Chart.yaml) missing
```
But I would like to work on this if it makes sense to change to `: No such file or directory`

@zdk This issue has been marked as a feature, and you have v2, for which we have stopped accepting feature PRs. You can use v3 and work on the fix, and I think the error message can be tweaked after the PR too, it shouldn't be a big change. You can start off by working on it for v3 (master branch) and raise a PR ðŸ˜„  do add tests wherever possible, with respect to this issue

issue.title: Friendly error message for non-existent file/directory

labels.name: size/L
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 100-499 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: v3.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3

issue.body:
Fixes https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/6713

Have updated the error message for the missing Chart.yaml

PS - This is my first PR here. Do let me know if I need to make any further changes.
cc @karuppiah7890

issue.title: Friendly error message for non-existent Chart.yaml file

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
Fixes #6713

Have updated the error message for the missing Chart.yaml
I created a [PR](https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/6743) for this, but that got messed up, so I am creating a fresh one.
This is almost my first PR so please do let me know if there is anything wrong, I will try to fix it.
I have created test for my change for helm/pkg/chart/metadata.go in helm/pkg/chart/metadata_test.go

cc @karuppiah7890

issue.title: Friendly error message for non-existent Chart while packaging

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: v3.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3

issue.body:
Fixes [#6713](https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/6713)

Have updated the error message for the missing Chart.
Please do let me know if there is anything wrong, I will try to fix it.
I have created test for my change for helm/pkg/chart/metadata.go in helm/pkg/chart/metadata_test.go

I raised a PR for this earlier, creating a new one as I lost my work.

@karuppiah7890 , As you suggested in the last PR [#7006](https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/7006)

> Thanks for the PR. It looks like it doesn't consider the issue that you have linked to. #6713 issue is about helm not giving an appropriate or accurate error for package sub command when the chart itself doesn't exist. Your test seems to be related to chart.yaml file not existing. Could you change the test according to the issue ? Make sure it's a failing test and then you can pass the test by fixing the code :)

I have made some changes while will give an error as you suggested(talking about the whole chart not only the Chart.yaml file.)

Thank You :)
